events.title: Germany's Surrender in World War II
events.description: Germany formally surrenders unconditionally to the Allies, marking the end of World War II in Europe.
events.significance: This event marks Victory in Europe (V-E) Day and the end of over six years of devastating war in Europe.

events.title: Sinking of the RMS Lusitania
events.description: The British ocean liner RMS Lusitania is sunk by a German U-boat, killing 1,198 passengers and crew.
events.significance: The sinking contributed to shifting public opinion in the United States against Germany during World War I.

events.title: Beethoven's Ninth Symphony Premiere
events.description: Ludwig van Beethoven's Ninth Symphony is performed for the first time in Vienna.
events.significance: This symphony is considered one of the greatest compositions in Western music history, notable for its choral finale "Ode to Joy."

events.title: Belgrade Protests Begin
events.description: Massive protests erupt in Belgrade, Yugoslavia, against Slobodan Milošević's regime following disputed elections.
events.significance: The protests marked significant political unrest during the breakup of Yugoslavia and led to substantial political change.

events.title: First Transatlantic Flight Attempt by Vickers Vimy
events.description: British aviators Alcock and Brown complete the first nonstop transatlantic flight from Newfoundland to Ireland (actual date of arrival is May 15, but departure May 7).
events.significance: This pioneering flight demonstrated the potential for transatlantic air travel and was a major milestone in aviation history.
